content: I have opened #19872 to rename docs#Subgroup.relindex to Subgroup.relIndex. @Eric Wieser pointed out that a similar argument would mean that docs#Module.finrank should be renamed to Module.finRank and docs#Subfield.relrank to Subfield.relRank.

I agree with relrank becoming relRank, but I fear that renaming finrank to finRank will push us towards FinSet, FinType, FinSupp and I don't think we want that because we as a community have reanalysed "finset", "fintype" and "finsupp" as single words.

I see a few possibilities along the slippery slope:

  • Don't rename anything
  • Rename relindex and relrank but not finrank
  • Rename relindex, relrank and finrank but not Finset, Fintype, Finsupp
  • Rename relindex, relrank, finrank, Finset, Fintype, Finsupp
Which ones are people most happy with?
I propose treating rel and fin as prefixes and not as separate words. They are not established words or abbreviations in the literature anyways.
Counterpoint which I don’t necessarily agree: nlab (and Wikipedia) calls them FinSet https://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/FinSet

The reason I originally wanted to change relindex specifically is that it reads almost like a word, probably because index starts with a vowel. The other examples Eric mentioned do not suffer the same issue.
FWIW, I picked up "finrank" as a single word through osmosis, as "a special version of rank". I prefer leaving it as-is.
I see a point for renaming "relindex"; that feels more like a short form for relativeIndex
An argument for renaming relindex/relrank but not finrank etc.: relrank unfolds to rank ... while finrank unfolds to Cardinal.toNat (rank ...).
Do we have examples in mathlib of rel as a prefix meaning "relative"? To me, it could just as well mean "relation", and relRank is ambiguous between relation rank and relative rank.

Bhavik Mehta said:

Do we have examples in mathlib of rel as a prefix meaning "relative"? To me, it could just as well mean "relation", and relRank is ambiguous between relation rank and relative rank.

Do you mean relrank does not have this problem or that the name is just bad and should be changed?

I'd say relrank has this problem, but to a lesser degree. My preference is to rename to relativeIndex/relativeRank and keep finrank as it is, since fin- is an established prefix for finiteness in mathlibese
